The hole is located at the center of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 2 units by 3 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 1 unit. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 0.3 units at the intersection with the second part.</description>

Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: - Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.1624. - Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0. The metallic hexagonal shape with a cylindrical hole is now complete. **Part 2: Construction of a CAD model of a long, thin, curved object with a pointed end.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following orientation and position: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.1637] Next, create the 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. For the long, thin, curved object: Sketch face 1 has a single loop (loop 1) with three curves: - line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1627], End Point [0.0933, 0.0] - arc 1: Start Point [0.0933, 0.0], Mid Point [0.0502, 0.1625], End Point [0.0942, 0.3248] - line 2: Start Point [0.0942, 0.3248], End Point [0.0, 0.1627] Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale: 0.3248. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: - Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0. - Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0097. The long, thin, curved object is now complete. The final shape will be created by combining part 1 and part 2 based on the boolean operation instructions provided.</description>
